problem_text:
19.96. Let M be a free metabelian group of finite rank r ⩾2, and let P be the set of its primitive elements. (An element of a relatively free group is said to be primitive if it can be included in a basis of the group.)
a) Is P a first-order definable set?
b) Is the set of bases of the group M a first-order definable set?
E. I. Timoshenko
